page.title: 01Evie in the Orkneys
page.content: This is a parish on the West Main- land bounded by low heather clad hills to the South and West, and by the sea and islands to the North and East. It is part of a submerged valley system which has suffered marine erosion. It is largely composed of limey flagstone, which has made the area, despite Northerly exposure, one of fertile soil, and so supports mixed types of farming. In the past this meant that there was a large farming population but the pattern is changing and the population is shifting. There is a wealth of indigenous flora and fauna, and this sometimes gives rise to differences of oppinion between farmers and conservationists. Nevertheless there is a strong community spirit and an active social community life which helps the parish to retain it's identity.
